intro: Streptocalyx murcae, commonly known as the rock streptocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly rough texture. Streptocalyx murcae is often found growing on rocky slopes or in shaded forest areas.
